page.title: 11BIRDS
page.content: THERE ARE OVER ONE HUNDRED DIFFERENT SPECIES OF BIRDS IN BURRA AND 35_40 SPECIES BREED AND NEST IN THE SUMMER MONTHS.IN BURRA MANY BIRDS LIVE ON CROFTLAND AND ROUGH MOORLAND.PLOVERS (SANDYLOOS)AND WHIMBRELS(PEERIE WHAAPS)CAN BE SEEN AND STARLINGS AND OYSTERCATCHERS(SHALDERS)ARE A COMMON SIGHT.THE TWITE(LINTIE) IS FAIRLY COMMON.IT CAN BE SEEN IN GROUPS AND THERE ARE FLOCKS OF UP TO TWENTY IN WEST BURRA.THE WREN IS ALSO FREQUENTLY SIGHTED.EIDER DUCKS(DUNTERS)BREED IN LARGE NUMBERS AND SIX PAIRS OF RED THROATED DIVERS(RAINGEESE)NEST HERE. THE WINTER SPECIES ON THE PURPLE SANDPIPER CAN BE SEEN ON THE ROCKY SHORELINE AND LONG TAILED DUCKS IN THE SHELTERED WATERS.THEY ARE WINTER VISITORS AND OVER ONE HUNDRED HAVE BEEN SEEN IN EAST BURRA.
